pros: Pay and benefits friendly coworkers and management

pros: Work hours. Fun and active environment. Loved working with students and feeling like I was really making a difference.
cons: Part time, so I had no benefits. Supervisor was a bit absentee at times.

job_title: Physical Sciences Laboratory Technician in Rockford, IL
pros: Very little oversight by management
cons: Jaded to clueless to hostile admin

job_title: IT Service Desk Specialist in Rockford, IL
pros: The work environment at Rock Valley College amongst coworkers is definitely 10/10!!! I've been here for 3 years so far and I have never had a problem with my coworkers. When I receive callers, they are very courteous and friendly, sometimes you can get caught into a conversation with callers. Never have I experienced being yelled at or harrassed for doing my job
cons: The HR (Human Resources) side of Rock Valley College is truly the dark side of this place. I was put in a situation where our department was being "restructured" (sidenote: we're still doing the same job, new title). And I basically was going to be changed into a new title with no salary change due to ICCB classifcation, all colleges have this HORRIBLE ICCB system that they must follow and it truly makes your job 10x harder if you wanted a raise/compensation for doing the job. Another con is they WILL low ball your pay. I had to unionize in order to get the pay I deserve.

review_title: Work load increases with out compensation
pros: Two week vacations, plus all holidays.
cons: In 16 years my hourly rate has gone up $2.50/hour. Pay increases have been frozen for many years and instead of increasing the pay they are re-structuring so you do more with no increase.

review_title: This job is just not for me

job_title: Manager of Building Operations in Rockford, IL
pros: Good atmosphere, decent amount of time off

job_title: Supplemental Instruction Leader in Rockford, IL
pros: Pretty laid back in this position

job_title: Customer Service in Traverse City, MI

review_title: Not a very diverse friendly atmosphere.
pros: Started with a clean slate in mind but saw that there is no future unless you have connections especially if you’re the right ethnicity.
cons: Moving forward for a person that is not Caucasian is almost impossible Or you have to have good connections.

review_title: Rock Valley lacks Diversity and neglects to address discrimination issues.
pros: The students are the best.
cons: The application is very lengthy. The training is not great. It is an organization with an unfriendly culture if you are a minority. It is an organization that typically does not hire Minorities and when they do they make them feel uncomfortable or treat them as if they are invisible. Possibly one of the worse places I have ever worked for

pros: Great people and great work environment. They really work with the students they have to fit your class time with work time.
cons: Depends on the department and how much your manager likes you. I saw other students get hired on to full time positions that had been working at RVC less then I had.

review_title: Great people to work with, not a great place to work for.
pros: The very best colleagues to work with. Genuinely want students to be successful. Many valuable collaborations and relationships built here.
cons: Not valued by the Board of Trustees. Students are green $$$ while faculty are red marks to their bottom line.

job_title: Instructor, College Or University in Rockford, IL
pros: Long history for this program and good reputation with the Industry and the FAA.
cons: Illinois State budget constraints are now limiting how and what Instructors can teach, aircraft are aging too quickly to be maintained by the program and leadership is a bit of a mess with a serious lack of consistency and communication

pros: Opportunity to work with many hard-working professionals to help students reach their potential.
